intro: Hieracium samolinum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting various pollinators. Hieracium samolinum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can spread through rhizomes and seeds.
